meanings.definition: To preserve in a fossil state.
meanings.sent1: The amber fossilized the tiny insect perfectly, preserving it for centuries.
meanings.sent2: The volcanic ash fossilized the ancient footprints, capturing a moment in time.
meanings.sent3: The idea of fossilizing memories in a time capsule intrigued the young students.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph seemed to fossilize the smiles of the family, frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree resin had the power to fossilize even the smallest creatures, immortalizing them in amber.
